jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

A65FFFC4CE8D4978AAB09409D462CCA8.description:
Recognize that some words are fingerspelled due to
domain-specific definition.

66DE06CF09C144088602B59EA07FDF85.description:
Use signs compounded with signs and lexicalized
fingerspelling.

DF7DD80A2C824AFA8CBD5874934DD3BD.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

B19465EA4F5B4FB790EA11B653AE777D.description:
Connect initialized forms and alphabet letters to their
equivalent in English.

7AD45B99E7CC4955A57B09AFF46BDAC8.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

94787A0B848A45B494361EFE4F59DDE2.description: Use fingerspelled words when there are no sign equivalents.

937E033BA6B14F7782A1ABA7A248E523.description:
Use fingerspelled words for emphasis though pacing,
chunking, and/or spatial.

70B7D2911BBB474098B4C0748B43B366.description:
Understand that fingerspelling is used for various purposes,
formally and informally.

693222BBF2804BFF8830DA0F56A054A9.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general
academic and domain-specific signs, fingerspelled words,
and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering
signs, fingerspelled words, or phrases important to
comprehension or expression.

7F99959B92614F1CBB9E97A6186C0191.description:
Use common, phonology awareness as clues to the meaning
of a word.

6313D3493EC5459E8C13458409D72015.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of signs
with similar denotations (definitions).

389BC0F8E27C4A90843154A967B345EB.description:
Use relationships between particular sign choices to better
understand each of the concepts/signs.

5302D706FC3A413A9EC918C44212D7DB.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, sign
relationships, and nuances in sign meanings.

5D6FEAD516154E13865C78F4F286CBE6.description:
Verify the meaning of a sign, depiction, or phrase (e.g.,
by checking the inferred meaning in context or other
accessible resource).

0DD7A3F39FF54F0C992101B3E70D958A.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g.,
general dictionaries and content-specific references), both
print and digital, to determine and clarify its meaning.

FF03C0FAB78A458E86AD7D5C2883CF7D.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and
comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a sign,
fingerspelled word, classifier, or phrase.

8B6830D4E9A140F59593578D20C929E9.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, spatial use, and phrases
based on grade 8 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from
a range of strategies.

FC52C196EA594A21A75D7D57A35B4FDC.description:
Fingerspell correctly and use a chaining approach when
introducing new academic signs.

827AF235E8B74F04B2D529E640816363.description:
Vary sentence patterns for meaning, viewer interest, and
style.

470471447C73434E9249D6AD2D0063C3.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

343295BEBE234931A3C17BC7D014224B.description:
Demonstrate command of the standard ASL grammar and
usage when signing (live and published).

A6CDE092E63749BCA12819A78AAF6996.description:
Adapt signs to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating
command of formal ASL when indicated or appropriate. (See
grade 8 Language standards for specific expectations.)

AE1A30C9F7694F6C862E2D95A896F1D2.description:
Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to
clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add
interest.

23CE75949D584C81872EE545401E1A1C.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in
a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, valid
reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye
contact, appropriate signing space, and clear production.

2CC498D60F19499EBE4FF44F1FC7F5CC.description:
Delineate a signer’s argument and specific claims, evaluating
the strength of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency
of the evidence and identifying when irrelevant evidence is
introduced.

628AC2FE7656481F9F6BE1B334FF51D0.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse
media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) and evaluate
the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its
presentation.

4C279338DB9343C192EA384E0ADFBC17.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and,
when warranted, qualify or justify their own views in light
of the evidence presented.

486767C4287B49EE95AADBADD0682963.description:
Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers
and respond to others’ questions and comments with
relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

ECE206805C3A49CD8EA7AFAB6266A90B.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making,
track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and
define individual roles as needed.

1D97AB4ADF364CFA8CFF6B1BB3DE9A40.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or researched
material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation
by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe
and reflect on ideas under discussion.

B3D5E93614C74CCFA57B2975343AED15.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

48373AF27DB1486D8EF0156970B63DF2.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames
(e.g., a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of disciplinespecific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

E56588CF5C71468E9C3D365BD4992826.description:
Apply grade 8 Viewing standards to literary nonfiction
(e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific
claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is solid
and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when
irrelevant evidence is introduced.”)

595BEBB7FBA34C0A8772700C7E14671A.description:
Apply grade 8 Viewing standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze
how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of
events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or
religious works.”).

6B09019ED71B4A0E87B29CA10369E51C.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

A0B1B40E1E194159B6DB6A0BE3D7DDE0.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple published
and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess
the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding
plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

49FA09E2CF5449718EF620BC60E82A47.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question
(including a self-generated question), drawing on several
sources and generating additional related, focused questions
that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

96455B0472F14227B75F2FC7BD6E2CE0.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A9B76776D0AD42D38FA3A9BE9AF24DDB.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish
signing and present the relationships between information
and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with
others, including linking to and citing sources

A0799C9C9E3A445193D7575FFBB61501.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults,
develop and strengthen signing as needed by planning,
revising, editing, re-signing, or trying a new approach, focusing
on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.
(Editing for structure should demonstrate command of
Language standards 1-3.)

72A9AEEBAA4147AC8AA369AB63505383.description:
Produce clear and coherent signing in which the development,
organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for signing types are
defined in standards 1-3 above.)

FAC1E90778A9466A8651A16CA51118FD.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

860CAB0FE2394F1B88A95DE6857F5F04.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the
narrated experiences or events.

FA23BB36EFB547319A50CF0DE8DEEF5C.description:
Use precise signs, depiction, and phrases, relevant
descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the
action and convey experiences and events.

B12E888CCE60416DAC755C330EB6DAF4.description:
Use a variety of transition signs, phrases, and clauses to
convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or
setting to another, and show the relationships among
experiences and events.

9BF264246005409889936B6D421F7932.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing,
description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events,
and/or characters.

C9C632EE5D9F45E8BEC640018207DB85.description:
Engage and orient the viewer by establishing a context and
point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters;
organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and
logically.

40B8CF06EE4D4F19B6272C075F6B282A.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details,
and well-structured event sequences.

C1E26A0586084DD2ABF6613149C3FBED.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

82AF3104F29B43D5BCB83A3F49381508.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
and supports the information or explanation presented.

956CDBDF97004ECBA551D0A51625069E.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

3FFAF92C9F6D46BDB7B80F30E5DA13A5.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion
and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

F0DF3E5BF3B84E359D5A679B0C8A5431.description:
Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts,
definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples.

F2345F5C0AB24E498B42FD1D1B007445.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow;
organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader
categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics
(e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

B4174FC425714F38B72DA5DE3D5992E3.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

0F46FD462C2B4236B2519AAF2D601C21.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

0DD33C8B932D48FEB6CE9DD886F9A3AC.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
and supports the argument presented.

7DF3B97F37D34264A9CBD1ABF7B0D05E.description:
Use words, phrases, depiction, and clauses to create
cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s),
counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

F4C73791D05F4A139252F53E0C5DB5F9.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant
evidence, using accurate, credible sources and
demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

4A47E69621AE4FA08B0B312F713143DD.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s)
from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons
and evidence logically.

11BEF678C2B741F6A2039C77F089BF2B.description:
Sign arguments to support claims with clear reasons and
relevant evidence.

E46DAD3D13FE48C08F8F71E90031E97F.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literary
nonfiction at the high end of the grades 6-8 text complexity
band independently and proficiently.

2E63DB81142A4EFEBC7B4B3FAE34BA1A.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

D07BD2A4619041019A7CB5BFB64BA9C5.description:
Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting
information on the same topic and identify where the texts
disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

FDA6C9AEC2C94496A55C809AEFDF54B6.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a
text, assessing whether the reasoning is solid and the evidence
is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence
is introduced.

08CD3DCCB3D941A28CB4E1ADD0CB4D94.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different
mediums (e.g., published text or digital sources, video,
multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

AF8F6BEE3D674F5DBD90BA81066E3712.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text
and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to
conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

B287691533FC4615A6FD764E9197D6C8.description:
Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text,
including the role of particular sentences in developing and
refining a key concept.

69A684A95D63452C885CE89801553A63.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are
used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical
meanings; analyze the impact of specific sign choices on
meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other
texts.

2FE43D2744C74819B341027D13922D18.description:
Analyze how a text makes connections among and
distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g.,
through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

9FCF49F159B046C6BF0CF89E766AB56C.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development
over the course of the text, including its relationship to
supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

AE2D0E2CFD134AA1A24E9E7ED3DDC0C8.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an
analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences
drawn from the text.

22075589871E4D7A9E2EAEBB3EB54460.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end
of grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

692784DC886148558D04672B173BD5C4.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

9F79CF0CBEE14A2AA0FA73AFE2658280.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes,
patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional
stories, or religious works describing how the material is
rendered new.

F9FDDDF72B56408990D5916C87C9792E.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a
story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or
script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

472D4A71A7CC47C6A60E6FF122499E46.description:
Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters
and the audience or viewer (e.g., created through the use of
dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

D4E13E4078674EDC9A396F244093ED30.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and
analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to
its meaning and style.

30C61DFED3E740BA9C1C4F859C3D3358.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are used
in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings;
analyze the impact of specific sign choices on meaning and
tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

C32D8860F94B4EA58AF7F66BBA2612A3.description:
Analyze how particular elements of dialogue or incidents in a
story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character,
or provoke a decision.

BF98CEFEB45D4651AFFD99FFB718AB26.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze
its development over the course of the text, including its
relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an
objective summary of the text.

59C8268B274140DF95FB72654477D683.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an
analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences
drawn from the text.
